newsitem.title: USA: Acclaim to cut 115 jobs, consolidate operations.
newsitem.headline: Acclaim to cut 115 jobs, consolidate operations.

text.p: Acclaim Entertainment Inc., a video game software company, said Thursday it will slash 115 jobs, consolidate administrative and operational functions and reduce operating budgets in a restructuring.
Acclaim, which also develops coin-operated arcade games, said it aims to save about $40 million a year through the cost-cutting plan.
All the job cuts will be at Acclaim's Glen Cove, N.Y. headquarters.

"It is anticipated that through the implementation of these measures that the company will become cash-flow positive based on our current operating plans," said Gregory Fischbach, Acclaim president and chief executive.
In April, the company reported a second-quarter loss of $16.8 million, compared with a $55.8 million loss for the same quarter in 1996.
Acclaim publishes software for video game and personal computer hardware systems and also publishes comic books under a variety of imprints.
Acclaim's stock rose 50 cents to $3.875 on Nasdaq.
